banner_title_p: Trainings and resources for therapists, educators, and parents who want to make a difference.
courses_description: The favorites of Therapists and Educators to transform child development into practice

1.title: Play and OT - Theory and Practice
1.description:
Play in Occupational Therapy – From Theory to Practice

Course
4-day in-person training

Instructor:
Paula Serrano – Occupational Therapist

Overview: Occupational therapists use play in practice both for assessment and intervention, but the specific use of play...
learningOutcomes: Theories and Frames of Reference
Development of Play and Playfulness Skills
Assessment Methods
Intervention Strategies
1.about_course_p: 4-day in-person training with Occupational Therapist Paula Serrano.
1.equipaments_p1: Occupational therapists use play in practice both for assessment and intervention, but the specific use of play in pediatric occupational therapy varies. In the occupational therapy literature on play, there are concerns regarding how occupational therapists approach the role of play in their intervention.
1.equipaments_p2: Various articles suggest limitations and a lack of emphasis on play-focused interventions by pediatric occupational therapists. These limitations include diminished attitudes toward play, with greater emphasis placed on competencies unrelated to play (e.g., motor, social skills), failure to assess play, and difficulty defining a play-focused intervention plan.
1.equipaments_p3: However, assessing play and engaging in play-focused interventions are vital for child development, health, and honoring childhood.

course_content_title1_li.3: The Evolution of Play in Occupational Therapy
course_content_title1_li.4: Frames of Reference for Play in Occupational Therapy
course_content_title1_li.5: The Developmental Sequence of Play Throughout Childhood

course_content_title2_li.4: Instruments: Revised Knox Preschool Play Scale (Knox); Test of Playfulness (TOP) (Bundy)

course_content_title3_li.1: The Role of the Occupational Therapist

2.title: Clinical Reasoning and Sensory Integration Intervention in Early Childhood
2.description:
Clinical reasoning and intervention in sensory integration in early childhood

Training Program: 24 hours

Instructor:
Paula Serrano – Occupational Therapist

Intervention Area:
Sensory Integration

General Objectives: Reflect on development in the early years...
learningOutcomes: Understand factors influencing early childhood development
Apply neuroscience knowledge in sensory integration practice
Use tools like SPM2 and Dunn's Sensory Profile
Develop clinical reasoning in assessment data analysis

title_1.title: About the Course
title_1.p: Duration – 24 hours with Occupational Therapist Paula Serrano.

title_3.title: Target Audience
title_3.p: Occupational therapists certified in Sensory Integration

1.title: A crianca e a Motricidade Fina
1.description: Fine motor skills are how we use our arms, hands, and fingers. They refer to the skills needed to manipulate an object, meaning how to use the hand and fingers precisely, according to the demands of the activity. The development of fine motor skills is essential for the child's interaction with the environment and happens when the child engages with objects and uses tools, for example in daily life activities. This book focuses on the development of fine motor skills across different childhood age groups, illustrating their relationship with the child's everyday life. In addition to development, it explores the skills required for fine motor skills to develop smoothly. It also recommends equipment and materials that can help children who have difficulties in this area.
1.recommendedAge: Educators and parents of children aged 2-7 years

2.title: A Integracao Sensorial
2.description: Sensory integration is the neurological process that organizes our sensations and is the foundation for all forms of learning so that we can live in the world and make sense of it. It is the base for academic learning, for the skills needed to perform daily life and social activities, and even for the ability to have empathy for others. What we see, smell, hear, taste, or touch is deciphered at every moment in our living experience, along with our 'hidden senses': vestibular and proprioceptive. When a child has problems processing sensations (sensory integration dysfunction), they struggle to use the information received through the senses to function efficiently in daily activities – problems may arise with motor coordination, sleep regulation, eating, attention, self-care tasks, learning, play, and emotional and social development.
2.recommendedAge: Professionals and parents of children aged 0–5

3.title: Brincar e Integracao Sensorial Nos Primeiros Anos
3.description: All babies are born with characteristics that make them unique. Gradually, they adapt to their family and the environment in which they are born, and naturally, development happens and autonomy emerges as they engage and move within the family's life cycle. Development is the term used to describe the changes in a child's physical growth and their ability to learn in terms of sensorimotor, socioemotional, cognitive behavior, and communication skills. All these areas are interconnected, each depending on and influencing the others, becoming visible through the baby's behavior and their increasing autonomy.
3.recommendedAge: Professionals and parents of children aged 0–5

4.title: O Desenvolvimento da Autonomia dos 0 aos 3 anos
4.description: All babies are born with characteristics that make them unique. Gradually, they adapt to the family and the environment they are born into, and naturally, development occurs, and autonomy begins to emerge as they engage and move within the family life cycle. Development is the term used to describe changes in a child's physical growth and their ability to learn in terms of sensory-motor behavior, socio-emotional, cognitive, and communication skills. All of these areas are interconnected, and each one depends on and influences the others, being visible in the baby's behavior and their growing autonomy.
4.recommendedAge: Parents and caregivers of children aged 0-3 years

5.title: A Integração Sensorial e o Engajamento Ocupacional na Infância (eBook)
5.description: This eBook explores the relationship between sensory integration and occupational engagement in childhood, providing practical tools for professionals and parents.
5.recommendedAge: Professionals and parents of children aged 0-8 years

6.title: A Linguagem e o Brincar em Condicoes Neurodiversas (eBook)
6.description: A complete collection of sensory activities and games to naturally and funly stimulate children's development.
6.recommendedAge: Parents and educators of children aged 1-6 years

7.title: Instrumentos de Avaliacao do Modelo Ludico (eBook)
7.description: An essential guide on the milestones of child development and how to identify early signs that may require specialized attention.

8.title: The Role of Play in Child Assessment and Intervention (eBook)
8.description: A complete manual with practical strategies to promote children's autonomy in the early years of life, following the principles of evidence-based approaches.
8.recommendedAge: Parents and educators of children aged 0-5 years

tranings_mentorships_description_p: Discover how mentorship can transform your career.
tranings_mentorships_description_h2: Professional Mentorship: What Is It and What Are Its Benefits?
tranings_mentorships_description_h2_p: Professional mentorship is a process where a more experienced professional (mentor) guides and supports a less experienced professional (mentee) in career development. This relationship is based on the exchange of experiences, knowledge, and practical advice, helping the mentee overcome challenges and develop skills.
mentorships_ul_lu1: Access to valuable knowledge and experiences.
mentorships_ul_lu2: Insights into best practices and effective strategies.
no_books_find: No books found for your search.
about_p1: I am an occupational therapist with 30 years of experience in clinical practice and 20 years dedicated to teaching. Throughout my career, I have always sought training from the world's leading references in the field, which led me to specialize in sensory integration and play in the United States. Clinical practice, combined with teaching, has allowed me to build solid clinical reasoning and develop an evidence-based approach. This methodology is proven daily in the care provided to the many children and families I have had the privilege to work with.
about_p2: I deeply believe that childhood is a transformative period in which we, as professionals, have the opportunity to significantly alter the life paths of children and their families. This belief brings great responsibility to my clinical practice but also a commitment to sharing knowledge.
bio_p1: Paula Serrano – Occupational Therapist since 1993. Holds a Master's degree in Occupational Therapy – Specialization in Sensory Integration, from the Escola Superior de Saúde do Alcoitão.
bio_p2: Certified in Sensory Integration by the University of Southern California – Department of Occupational Science and Therapy and Western Psychological Services. Also certified in Neurodevelopmental Treatment (Bobath) by the European Bobath Tutors' Association.
bio_p3: Has 30 years of clinical experience working with children and families.
bio_p4: Clinical director, coordinator, and occupational therapist at the Center for Stimulation for Development and Learning «Miúdos & Etc.».
bio_p5: Certified trainer in the fields of child development, special education, sensory integration, and play since 2000. Has also been active as a trainer in Brazil and Spain since 2018.
bio_p6: Guest assistant professor in the Master's program in Occupational Therapy, specializing in Sensory Integration, since 2006.
bio_p7: Co-supervisor of several master’s theses in the areas of play and sensory integration.
book_author: She is the author of the books:
author_coauthor: Author and co-author of chapters of the books:

folowers_p: Discover the experiences of our clients with our courses and mentorships
contact_our_valor1: At Paula Serrano, we value every connection with our clients. Whether it's to clarify doubts, receive valuable feedback, or simply have a chat, our team is always ready to listen and help.
contact_our_benefits2: Get technical information about our products
contact_our_benefits3: Provide suggestions to improve our services
contact_contact_imediatly: For immediate assistance during business hours (Mon-Fri: 9 am to 6 pm), you can also contact us directly by phone (+351) 965 430 026. We guarantee an email response within 24 business hours for all messages received.
contact_us_success: Thank you! We will get back to you shortly.
footer_bottom: Paula Serrano Educação, Lda. All rights reserved.
home_val_p: Fundamental principles that guide every decision and initiative
mission_p1: We value the sharing of knowledge as a powerful tool to broaden horizons and bring more quality of life to families. We believe that by disseminating knowledge, we can create a positive impact that goes far beyond the individual, reaching entire communities.
mission_p2: We strive to create an environment where each child can flourish at their own pace, respecting their individuality and supporting their holistic development. Our approach recognizes that every growth journey is unique.

1.title: Innovation
1.text: We constantly seek new approaches and methodologies to improve our educational practices.

2.title: Integrity
2.text: We act with transparency and honesty in all our interactions and decisions.

3.title: Empathy
3.text: We put ourselves in others' shoes to understand their unique needs and challenges.

4.title: Excellence
4.text: We are committed to the highest standards of quality in everything we do.

5.title: Collaboration
5.text: We value teamwork and the exchange of ideas to achieve meaningful results.

6.title: Respect
6.text: We recognize and value the diversity of experiences and perspectives in our community.

commitments_p1: Through courses, mentoring, and teaching materials, our goal is to empower professionals in their daily practices. We provide tools for them to support children and families in their journey of growth and development. In this way, we aim to contribute so that each human being can reach their full potential, respecting their uniqueness and promoting a more inclusive and strengthened society.
commitments_p2: We are committed to creating accessible resources and programs that inspire educators and families to work together for the well-being of children. We believe that through this collaboration, we can lay the foundations for a future where all children have the opportunity to thrive.
mentorship_program_h1_p: Develop your skills and accelerate your career with specialized guidance.
mentorship_h3_1_p: Our professional mentorship is designed for professionals who seek to accelerate their career development through personalized guidance. With weekly meetings and continuous support, you will gain access to valuable insights and practical strategies to achieve your professional goals.

1.text: Personalized insights on your professional development.

2.text: Honest and constructive feedback on your strengths and areas for improvement.

3.text: Access to professional networks and exclusive opportunities.

mentorship_h3_3_p: Our methodology combines individual mentoring sessions, practical exercises, and projects tailored to your professional context. We work with a structured approach in 3 phases:

1.text: Diagnosis and definition of clear objectives.

2.text: Development of strategies and action planning.

indiv.text: A personalized approach tailored to your specific career needs. Exclusive sessions with your dedicated mentor focused on your goals and particular challenges.

group.text: Learn in a collaborative environment with other professionals, sharing experiences and expanding your network.
group.li3: Networking with professionals from different fields

1.question: How does the mentorship process work?
1.answer: The mentorship process begins with an assessment of your profile and professional goals. Next, we establish a personalized plan with regular meetings where you will receive guidance, feedback, and challenges to accelerate your development.

2.question: What is the duration of the mentorship?
2.answer: The duration of the mentorship will be defined after assessing the needs.

3.question: What are the prerequisites to participate?
3.answer: There are no formal prerequisites, only the commitment to your development and availability for the scheduled meetings.

4.question: How are the meetings conducted?
4.answer: The meetings are held remotely through video conferencing platforms such as Zoom or Google Meet, providing flexibility and convenience for all participants.

imerssion_p: Take your professional practice to the next level with our specialized immersion program.
imerssion_geral_p: Our immersion program offers an intensive practical experience for professionals and students who want to improve their clinical skills in a real and supervised environment. During the immersion period, you will have the opportunity to apply theoretical knowledge in practical situations, receiving direct feedback from experienced supervisors.

1.title: Practical Experience
1.text: Learn through practice with real cases and authentic clinical situations.

2.title: Individualized Mentoring
2.text: Direct supervision with experienced professionals and continuous feedback.

3.title: Distinguished Certification
3.text: Earn a certificate that proves your intensive practical experience.

1.title: Individual Immersion
1.text: Personalized attention focused on your specific needs.

3.title: Intensive Immersion
3.text: Comprehensive immersion program with theoretical and practical modules.

1.title: Initial Assessment
1.text: We conduct an interview to understand your specific needs and goals. This step allows us to personalize your immersion experience and maximize learning.

2.title: Personalized Planning
2.text: We develop a detailed immersion plan, including schedule, topics to be covered, and methodologies to be applied during the program.

3.title: Immersion Experience
3.text: You participate in scheduled activities, alternating between theoretical learning and practical application, always with supervision from our team.

4.title: Feedback
4.text: Throughout the immersion, you will receive continuous feedback on your performance, enabling real-time professional growth.

5.title: Certification
5.text: At the end of the program, you will receive your certification.

steps.title: Next Steps
steps.h3: Ready to start your journey of professional transformation?
steps.p: The process to participate in our immersion programs is simple and straightforward:

1.text: Schedule an initial consultation with our team via the contact form or phone.

2.text: We conduct a brief interview to understand your needs and goals.

3.text: Receive a detailed proposal with program options, dates, and costs.

4.text: Make your reservation and get ready for a transformative experience.

imerssion_contact_us.title: Ready to Elevate Your Professional Experience?
imerssion_contact_us.text: Contact us for more information about our immersion programs and schedule a consultation with our experts.

1.title: Introduction
1.p: Paula Serrano Educação, Lda. is committed to protecting the privacy and personal data of its users. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and protect the information provided by visitors to our website.

2.title: Data Collected
2.p: We may collect the following personal data:

li.1: Name and email address (when provided by the user through contact or registration forms).
li.2: Information voluntarily provided in interactions on the website.
li.3: Browsing data, such as IP address, device type, and on-site behavior, for statistical purposes and to improve user experience.

3.title: Purpose of Data Collection
3.p: The collected data will be used for:

li.1: Responding to information and contact requests.
li.2: Sending communications related to services, courses, and events (if the user has provided consent).

4.title: Contact
4.p: For more information about our Privacy Policy or to exercise your rights, contact us via email:

5.title: Data Security
5.p: We implement technical and organizational security measures to protect personal data against unauthorized access, loss, or alteration.

li.1: Access, correct, or delete their personal data.
li.2: Withdraw consent for data processing, when applicable.
li.4: File a complaint with the relevant Data Protection Authority (CNPD).

7.title: Cookies and Tracking Technologies
7.p: The website may use cookies to enhance user experience. Users can configure their browser to refuse cookies, although this may affect website navigation.

8.title: Changes to the Privacy Policy
8.p: Paula Serrano Educação, Lda. may update this Privacy Policy at any time. Any changes will be published on the website and will take effect immediately.

9.title: Contact
9.p: For more information about our Privacy Policy or to exercise your rights, contact us through the means provided on the website.

1.title: What are Cookies?
1.p: Cookies are small text files stored on your device (computer, tablet, or mobile phone) when you visit a website. These files allow the website to recognize your device and store some information about your preferences or previous actions.

2.title: Why do we use Cookies?
2.p: On the Paula Serrano Educação website, cookies are used to:

li.2: Ensure efficient and secure website functionality.
li.3: Analyze traffic and browsing behavior to optimize content and functionality.
li.4: Remember user preferences for future visits.

3.title: Types of Cookies Used
3.p: Our website may use the following types of cookies:

li.1: Necessary for the website to function. Without these cookies, some services cannot be provided.
li.2: Collect information about how visitors use the website (e.g., most visited pages). This data is anonymous and only used to improve the website's functionality.
li.3: Allow the website to remember user preferences (e.g., language or region) and provide a more personalized experience.
li.4: May use external services like Google Analytics to analyze traffic. These cookies are managed by third parties and follow their own privacy policies.

4.title: Managing Cookies
4.p: When accessing our website for the first time, a notification will be presented with the option to accept or configure cookies. Users can change their cookie settings at any time in their browser, enabling or disabling some or all cookies. Please note that disabling essential cookies may affect the website's functionality.

5.title: Changes to the Cookie Policy
5.p: Paula Serrano Educação may update this policy periodically. We recommend checking this page regularly to stay informed about any changes.

6.title: Contact
6.p: If you have any questions about this Cookie Policy or how your data is managed, please contact us through the channels available on the website.

payment_confirm_p: Thank you for your purchase. Your transaction has been completed successfully.
confirmation_email_li: We have sent a confirmation email to your registered email address.
contact_support_team_li: For any questions, please contact our support team.
payment_cancelled.title: Payment Cancelled
cancelled_message_p: Your payment was not completed. Your account was not charged.
payment_reasons_p: Your payment was not completed for one of these reasons:
cancelled_manually_li: The payment process was manually cancelled.
issue_payment_method_li: Your payment method could not be processed.
connection_time_li: The connection timed out during payment.
declined_by_bank_li: Your payment was declined by your bank.
why_cancelled_p: Please tell us why you cancelled your payment:
issues_payment_opt: I had issues with my payment method
our_support_team_p: Our support team is available to help with any issues you may have encountered.
alert_session_expired: Your session has expired. Please start the checkout process again.
whatsapp_default_msg: Hello, I would like more information...
